name: Winston Churchill
bio: Led Britain through its darkest hour. Famous for inspiring speeches and determination to never surrender.

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
bio: Led US through Great Depression and WWII. Died in office April 1945, weeks before victory.

name: Harry S. Truman
bio: Became president upon FDR's death. Made decision to use atomic bombs.

name: Joseph Stalin
bio: Led Soviet Union through Great Patriotic War. Suffered highest casualties but played decisive role in defeating Germany.

name: Adolf Hitler
bio: Nazi dictator who initiated WWII. Committed suicide in Berlin bunker April 30, 1945.

name: Benito Mussolini
bio: Fascist dictator who led Italy into WWII. Deposed 1943, executed by partisans 1945.

name: Emperor Hirohito
bio: Japanese emperor during WWII. Announced surrender August 15, 1945 via radio broadcast.

name: Charles de Gaulle
bio: Led Free French forces from exile. Returned triumphantly to liberated Paris.

name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
bio: Led Allied forces in Europe. Planned and executed D-Day invasion.

name: Georgy Zhukov
bio: Most successful Soviet military commander. Led defense of Moscow and capture of Berlin.

name: Bernard Montgomery
bio: Led British forces to victory at El Alamein. Commanded ground forces during D-Day.

name: Erwin Rommel
bio: 'Desert Fox' - respected even by enemies for tactical brilliance. Forced to suicide 1944.

name: Douglas MacArthur
bio: Led Allied forces in Pacific Theater. Accepted Japanese surrender aboard USS Missouri.

name: Chiang Kai-shek
bio: Led Chinese Nationalist forces against Japan throughout the war.

name: Hideki Tojo
bio: Led Japan during most of Pacific War. Executed as war criminal 1948.
